IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ITS STUDENTS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.MissionDescription: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ITS STUDENTS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES THEM FOR LIFE, WORK AND SERVICE. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATION TRADITIONS, CHAMINADE ENCOURAGES THE DEVELOPMENT OF MORAL CHARACTER AND PERSONAL COMPETENCIES, AND THE COMMITMENT TO BUILD A JUST AND PEACEFUL SOCIETY. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS THE CIVIC AND CHURCH COMMUNITIES OF THE PACIFIC REGION ITS ACADEMIC AND INTELLECTUAL RESOURCES IN THE PURSUIT OF COMMON AIMS.
IRS990.Description: CHAMINADE OFFERS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES STUDENTS FOR LIFE, SERVICE AND SUCCESSFUL CAREERS. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATIONAL TRADITIONS AND ACCREDITED BY THE WESTERN ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, CHAMINADE PROVIDES 2800 STUDENTS WITH 23 UNDERGRADUATE, 7 GRADUATE AND ACCELERATED ADULT EVENING PROGRAMS.

Activity2.Description: AUXILIARY ENTERPRISES AT CHAMINADE INCLUDE A 400 STUDENT RESIDENCE HALL PROGRAM; DINING SERVICES FEATURING THE SILVERSWORD CAFE, COURTYARD PATIO, AND BROTHERS' BREW COFFEE SHOP; NCAA PACIFIC WEST CONFERENCE DIVISION II ATHLETIC PROGRAM ANUALLY HOSTING THE MAUI INVITATIONAL BASKETBALL TOURNAMENT; STUDENT BOOKSTORE, COPY CENTER AND MAIL SERVICES.

OtherLiabilities.Description: UNSECURED NOTES PAYABLE TO MARIANIST CENTER OF HAWAII

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: REGENT OF EO AND OFFICER OF MARIANIST CENTER OF HAWAII
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: EO LEASES LAND AND CERTAIN BUILDINGS FROM MARIANIST CENTER OF HAWAII.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: FACULTY MEMBER OF CHAMINADE AND HUSBAND OF FORMER OFFICER OF EXEMPT ORG
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: SALARY PAYMENTS TO FACULTY MEMBER/INTERESTED PERSON

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A draft of the 990 will be submitted to the Audit Committee at their April 2011 Meeting for review prior to finalization & filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH YEAR, IN JULY/AUGUST, THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE EMAILS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS TO EACH CURRENT MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF REGENTS. FORMS ARE THEN SENT BACK TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE, WHO REVIEWS THE COMPLETED FORMS AND TRACKS WHICH FORMS MAY STILL BE OUTSTANDING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT, THE BOARD NEGOTIATES THE CONTRACT IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE UNIVERSITY LEGAL COUNSEL. FOR OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES, COMPENSATION IS NEGOTIATED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY WHO CONSULTS WITH THE PERSONNEL OFFICE & COMPARES COMPENSATION WITH PEER INSTITUTIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS & CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE & UPON REQUEST.
